ticket.title: link_to_tagged_current
ticket.original-body:
This patch adds a url helper that allows you to create a link, adding the class "current" when in the current page. I've found me using this helper much more than link_to_unless_current. I think it makes sense to push it to rails. == Examples Let's say you have a navigation menu... @@@ html
  • <%= link_to_tagged_current("Home", { :action => "index" }) %>
  • <%= link_to_tagged_current("About Us", { :action => "about" }) %>
@@@ If in the "about" action, it will render... @@@ html
  • Home
  • About Us
@@@ ...but if in the "index" action, it will render: @@@ html
  • Home
  • About Us
@@@

ticket.original-body-html:
This patch adds a url helper that allows you to create a link, adding the class "current" when in the current page.

I've found me using this helper much more than link_to_unless_current. I think it makes sense to push it to rails.

== Examples

Let's say you have a navigation menu... 

<ul id="navbar">
  <li><%= link_to_tagged_current("Home", { :action => "index" }) %></li>
  <li><%= link_to_tagged_current("About Us", { :action => "about" }) %></li>
</ul>

If in the "about" action, it will render... 

<ul id="navbar">
  <li><a href="/controller/index">Home</a></li>
  <li><a href="/controller/about" class="current">About Us</a></li>
</ul>

...but if in the "index" action, it will render: 

<ul id="navbar">
  <li><a href="/controller/index" class="current">Home</a></li>
  <li><a href="/controller/about">About Us</a></li>
</ul>
